activities: Initialized Serena project
Read HANDOFF.md for project context
Read usage-mandatory memory
Read pr-template-requirement memory
Read github-cli-pr-operations memory
Fetched GitHub docs on keywords in issues and PRs
Documented 9 linking keywords (close/closes/closed, fix/fixes/fixed, resolve/resolves/resolved)
Documented cross-repository linking syntax
Documented auto-close behavior on merge
Compiled Conventional Commits format standards
Documented PR template sections and usage
Created comprehensive analysis document with 7 sections
Covered GitHub keywords, Conventional Commits, PR template usage
Documented review etiquette and CI etiquette
Created gold standard flow for new developers
Integrated with project-specific requirements

Indexed key concepts for cross-session retrieval
Analyzed existing agent structure (implementer, pr-comment-responder, qa)
Analyzed existing skill structure (github skill, scripts)
Analyzed existing command structure (push-pr)
Identified integration points across 4 areas: skills, agents, commands, validation

Defined 10 success metrics for measuring impact

Created rollout plan with weekly milestones

artifacts.description: Comprehensive guide covering GitHub keywords, Conventional Commits, and PR etiquette for new developers
Implementation plan for integrating knowledge into agents, skills, and commands with 4-phase rollout
Cross-session memory for quick reference on PR etiquette

decisions.decision: Structured analysis as comprehensive guide covering keywords, Conventional Commits, and PR template usage
decisions.rationale: Consolidates GitHub docs with project-specific requirements for new developer onboarding
Links general GitHub etiquette to project constraints (ADR-005, ADR-006, usage-mandatory)

decisions.decision: Created integration plan with 4 phases: skill enhancement, agent updates, command updates, optional new skill
decisions.rationale: Prioritizes high-value, low-effort changes first (validation scripts + agent prompts) with optional advanced features later

decisions.decision: Recommended Phase 1 + Phase 2 as immediate actions (3-5 hours effort)
decisions.rationale: Highest impact comes from validation infrastructure and agent prompt updates; builds on existing github skill; incremental approach allows iteration

decisions.decision: Designed Test-PRDescription.ps1 as GitHub skill enhancement rather than standalone skill
decisions.rationale: Leverages existing github skill infrastructure; avoids premature abstraction; can extract to dedicated skill later if validation logic grows complex

context.trigger: User /research command for GitHub keywords and PR etiquette, followed by integration analysis request
context.scope: GitHub issue linking keywords, Conventional Commits, PR template usage, review and CI etiquette, integration into agent/skill/command structure
context.sources: GitHub Docs, project PR template, existing Serena memories, existing agent/skill/command files
